“Now we art all here,” said Hastur meaningfully, “we must recount the Deeds of the Day.”

“Yeah. Deeds,” said Crowley, with the slightly guilty look of one who is attending church for the first time in years and has forgotten which bits you stand up for.

“Love of my life, you’ve hurt me
You’ve broken my heart and now you leave me
Love of my life, can’t you see?
Bring it back,...
body:
“Love of my life, you’ve hurt me
You’ve broken my heart and now you leave me
Love of my life, can’t you see?
Bring it back, bring it back
Don’t take it away from me, because you don’t know
What it means to me”

- Freddie Mercury, through the speakers of the Bentley, much to Crowley’s embarrassment

title: Revolution - Chapter 45 (Supernatural fic)
body:
Chapter Summary - The dreams are getting worse and the strain is starting to show

CHAPTER 45 - United States of Lucifer

(Proof reading errors likely)

_______


“Hey my little honey bun, my darling ray of heaven shine, my first love.”

“Would you stop invading my dreams?” you don’t even look up. You just know it’s Lucifer again.

Every night you’d been dreaming about him. Every night he’d been taunting you. Every night he made threats about Crowley.

You’d had enough.

“Well that isn’t nice,” you can hear the pout. “Aren’t you happy for me? I moved on.”

“What?” you look up and you’re aghast to see the president’s face staring back at you. “Shit, you actually did it. You went for the highest authority.”

“Well duh,” he laughs. “Kinda had to right? Can’t mess things up by being a Joe nobody.”

“Wait, you said moved on?”

“Are you jealous?” the face flicks back to his Nick vessel as he comes closer very quickly, trying to study your expression. “Please tell me you’re jealous. I think that’d be soooo hot.”

“Why the hell would I be jealous? I feel sorry for whatever poor person has your attention now,” you scowl.

“She doesn’t have my attention,” Lucifer shakes his head. “She just has a convenient womb “

Your stomach drops as you process his words.

“You got someone pregnant?”

“Oh yeah,” he winks. “Although I have to say, sweetheart, you’re the much better lay. Oh baby, weren’t you just so…..tight….tight and willing. Why does someone so ughhhh have your love? Why do you put out for a guy like that and be so….I don’t know…enthusiastic about it?”

“Because he’s not a total sociopath like you are,” you point out. “And I love Crowley. Would you just drop this? I’m never going to agree to be your rent-a-womb.”

“I don’t want just that,” Lucifer captures you in his arms and you’re powerless to get away.

Whenever you dreamed about Lucifer, it was clear he was controlling the narrative. Sometimes you’d be in some romantic beach walk or a forest stroll, sometimes it was a luxurious bedroom. He also controlled some of your actions. He’d never make you do anything sordid but if he wanted you to stay still, you’d just freeze up.

“What do you want then?”

“I want you,” Lucifer runs his slightly chilled fingers across your cheekbone and down to trace the line of your jaw. Then he tips your chin up so you’re looking at him. “This little human nobody who resisted my best techniques for days. The little human who’s thwarted me a few times. The little human who, when I wore her boyfriend’s skin, made me feel wanted and loved. The little human who could bear me a child and live.”

And there was that uncharacteristically vulnerable side to him again. It always made you uneasy with how much you felt pity for him. It made you uneasy that you could rationalise his obsessive behaviour with that fact that he’d never experienced love or kindness.

His face is so close to yours now and you can see the lingering sadness in his gaze mixed with the raw need.

“Just let me have one last kiss before I go back to her,” he pleads quietly.

“No,” you reply firmly. “I’m not falling for your shit again. I’m happy with Crowley. I love Crowley.”

“Not the answer I wanted,” his eyes flash. “Let’s just hope Crowley sticks around then, huh? Would be a shame if something happened to him…if you found out something about him….”

He steps back quickly, moving so rapidly it’s like you scalded him before he morphs back into the president.

“Forgive me, little Tabitha., my little tabby cat.  I have places to go, my little secretary to protect. I hope it’s a boy, you know? I’d like that.”

“You’re twisted,” you snarl. “Don’t threaten Crowley, ever and never try to come between us. Stop coming to me in dreams. Stop parading your virility like I give a shit.”

He appears in front of you, hand around your throat as he squeezes, not hard but enough to let you know he could snap your neck with no effort.

“Be careful, Tabitha. I enjoy you, I enjoy your stubbornness but don’t ever think you’re better than me or…”

You felt pain. Pain was gripping your entire body and Lucifer was just staring down at you with a modicum of interest.

**

“Tabs?!”

You’d apparently started screaming in real life because the next you knew, Dean and Sam were in your room, trying to shake you awake.

Crowley had long gone. He only ever stayed with you until you fell asleep before doing day to day admin down in Hell. You wished he were here with you though.

“Are you okay?” both brothers are holding you, half perched on the bed.

“Another devil special wasn’t it?” Dean guesses.

“It’s every night,” you start shaking. “He won’t stop.”

“Why now?”

“Maybe it’s because she’s a prophet?” Sam guesses. “I mean she’s got a connection to heavenly and demonic beings right?”

“Chuck should’ve just left me alone,” you try to calm your racing heartbeat. “Lucifer’s the president now by the way. My dream confirmed it.”

“Goddamnit,” Dean huffs.

Both brothers sit fully on your bed. You knew this was going to be a tough conversation ahead.

“We can’t go after the president like this,” Sam sighs. “He’d have to be…I don’t know…out somewhere? A visit? We have no chance getting into the White House.”

“And Tabs can’t do this with us,” Dean adds.

“Dean, she’s dealt with him before. She’s fine.”

“She’s not fine!” Dean gestures. “She’s having freaky dreams every night and she’s terrified, Sammy. Look at her! We need to start stepping up and realising she can’t do this alone. We need to help her out and get rid of this archdouchebag.”

You were a tough woman but even you knew your limits. Lucifer’s constant attention and efforts was wearing you down and you were becoming afraid. He’d gotten into your head and you felt like you couldn’t have one moment’s peace away from him.

“I can’t do this, guys,” you shake your head. “I can’t face him again.”

“We get it,” Sam strokes your back. “I’m not going to push you into doing anything and I think you’re making a mistake hiding from him but I understand why you would want to.”

“Give her a break,” Dean scowls. “You went a little nutso when Lucifer was stalking you, remember?”

“Because he wanted to possess my body, Dean.”

“Yeah and he wants Tabs to be his baby mama. One is more scary than the other. You just had Lucifer’s essence wanting to be in you rather than his…you know…johnson.”

“Eww,” Sam wrinkles his nose.

“Right?!” Dean throws his arms out. “So give her a break.”

“Normally I would say something like ‘I’m right here’ but you’re right Dean,” you murmur, staring at the bed covers.

Dean looks like you’ve just told him a girl covered in pizza with some rare rock vinyls is waiting for him in his bedroom. His eyes practically glow with happiness.

“See that, I’m right,” he smiles smugly.

“Goddamnit, Dean,” Sam mutters. “Alright, we’ll chase after Lucifer. You stay here-”

“No, I’m not staying here,” you shake your head fervently. “I’m going to stay with Crowley.”

“In Hell?”

“Crowley will know some magic to help or at least be able to watch over me in my dreams,” you explain.

“Tabitha, if Lucifer smokes out of the president he can get you there. He can’t get here, it’s warded,” Sam says gently.

“I don’t care, I just need….” you trail off, biting your lip but it doesn’t stop the lump in your throat or the tears from starting to form in your eyes and start tracking down your face.

Neither of the Winchester brothers know what to do now. You’ve rarely cried around either of them but the stress and the disrupted sleep was getting to you in a bad way.

“Okay, do it,” Dean nods solemnly. “You know I’m not his biggest fan but if he helps, go to him Tabs.”

“Thank you,” you manage to get out.

Dean whips out his phone and starts dialling Crowley which you didn’t expect at all. In fact it was the last thing you expected.

“Yeah, it’s me. Well gee, don’t sound so surprised,” Dean makes a face as he walks with the phone. “No, it’s Tabs. She needs you. She-”

“What’s wrong?” Crowley asks immediately upon appearing.

“Wow, can’t even get takeout delivered that fast,” Dean widens his eyes before shaking his head. “Come on, Sammy. Let’s leave them alone.”

You hear something suspiciously like 'I never knew you could be this mature’ from Sam as they both head out, closing the door behind them.

“You’re crying,” Crowley says softly, bundling you into his embrace. “Why are you crying, pet?”

“Lucifer.”

The grip tightens and you can hear the growl starting in his chest.

“Again?”

“Again,” you affirm. “Take me with you.”

“Hell is not a place for you, darling. We both know this. We’ve tried it before and-”

“I don’t care. Take me with you. I can’t stand it any more. You can help me.”

He goes quiet for a time, rocking back and forth with you to calm you down. Just being in his presence is helping you enormously.

“Alright,” he finally agrees. “Pack some things and say your goodbyes to the Chuckle Brothers.”

You do so, eager to get out of the bunker. It’d been so suffocating being here lately and you were glad to be leaving for a little while.

When Crowley appears in his quarters with you, you immediately drag him to the big four poster bed, scrambling onto the silk sheets.

“You’re sending me mixed signals, love,” Crowley raises an eyebrow.

“I just need to be close,” you tell him before taking off his overcoat, jacket and shirt, leaving his chest bare for you to lie on.

“I’ve never seen you like this,” Crowley starts petting your hair. “You’re positively timid.”

“I never get any rest,” you murmur. “If it’s not my dreams, I have these awful visions all the time. I’m cracking up.”

“I’ve got you,” Crowley leans down and kisses your forehead. “I’ll always protect you, pet. You know that, right?”

“I know, I know.”

“Get some sleep. I promise you won’t dream.”

You trust him so you just let yourself absorb the warmth from his skin, the slow movements of his chest and his hand which keeps stroking your hair. You feel your body just relax, all the coiled muscles just letting go and eventually the exhaustion pulls you under.



**



He’s right. You don’t dream.

You woke up some time later, still in the position you fell asleep in only with Crowley humming some melody you didn’t recognise.

“Oh hello, kitten,” you hear him say. “Feel better?”

“A lot,” you admit, rubbing the remnants of sleep out of your eyes. “Thank you.”

“Always, my love.”

You look up at him, seeing the pure affection sparkling in his eyes. It was quite mesmeric in a way. You reach up, taking his bristled cheek in your hand before kissing him softly.

It starts out innocent but becomes something more heated very quickly, even though you didn’t intend it to. Crowley pushes you onto your back so he can lean over you, his hands gently stroking your sides. You can’t help but let soft moans sound out as you move into his touch.

“You are sublime,” he rasps out, drawing back for a second before he dives back on you and you feel the warm metal of your amulet tickling against your skin as he fully seats himself between your legs.

You needed this, you needed him. You needed him to stake a claim so to speak, to feel like you were his completely. Lucifer was trying to take that away from you but you wouldn’t let him.

“You are mine,” Crowley catches the thought. “I have fought so hard to show you that, to be worthy of that. Don’t doubt it now.”

“I love you,” you press your forehead to his.

“I love you always, my kitten.”

Just as you start kissing again, your phone rings out, the ringtone unfamiliar.

“It’s probably important,” Crowley breaks off, giving you a rueful smirk. “Perhaps Dean’s eaten Sam’s chocolate protein balls again.”

You tap him on the chest in mock chastisement before answering it.

“Hello?”

“Tabs?!” comes Dean’s voice.

“Are you okay?!”

“Uh no. No we’re not okay. Listen, I got one phone call-”

“You got arrested?!” your voice pitches up.

“Yeah kinda….by the FBI. We went for him, the big L I mean. He’s outta the president now but he knocked up the secretary. Cas has her but we didn’t manage to get out in time so…help.”

“Yeah, yeah. I’ll do what I can. Sit tight.”

“You’re cute,” comes the sarcastic reply. “Hurry up. Orange is not my colour.”

“Trouble?” Crowley surmises as you hang up.

“Well Lucifer is no longer the president but he’s got another girl pregnant and Sam and Dean are in holding cells, god knows where. Maybe the Pentagon?”

“Just another ordinary day, hmm?” Crowley raises an eyebrow. “I assume they need my assistance as well?”

“Probably,” you nod. “At least I got some rest then.”

“You can always come back once they’re free. I admit, I was sceptical this could work but without my odious mother hanging around all the time, this is like bunking off work to have fun in the storage cupboard.”

“Except the storage cupboard is an expensive bed.”

“Well I can make a cupboard if you really want to. Perhaps a pencil skirt and a blouse with a criminally low amount of buttons?”

“Crowley, I need to help them,” you move out from under him. “We can talk sexy roleplay when they’re not being detained in Guantanamo or wherever.”

“I’m holding you to that,” he winks. “Come on, pet. Let’s save Beavis and Butthead.”

You at least had taken comfort that Lucifer was not in an almost unreachable vessel any more. That gave you a bit more confidence back. Coupled with Crowley’s support and taking care of you, you were refreshed in a way that you hadn’t been for weeks.

Maybe all you really needed was some alone time, some bonding time without interference. There’d been precious little of that lately what with all the catastrophes.

Now you were ready to face the world….if only you could find where the hell the boys were that is….


____

Taglist

@samael-has-arrived @shemehaza @blueboolu @astridstark13 @jointhehunt67 @oldsoulevy @i-only-signed-up-for-fanfiction

“Give her a break,” Dean scowls. “You went a little nutso when Lucifer was stalking you, remember?”

“Because he wanted to possess my body, Dean.”

“Yeah and he wants Tabs to be his baby mama. One is more scary than the other. You just had Lucifer’s essence wanting to be in you rather than his…you know…johnson.”

“Eww,” Sam wrinkles his nose.

“Right?!” Dean throws his arms out. “So give her a break.”

“Normally I would say something like ‘I’m right here’ but you’re right Dean,” you murmur, staring at the bed covers.

Dean looks like you’ve just told him a girl covered in pizza with some rare rock vinyls is waiting for him in his bedroom. His eyes practically glow with happiness.

“See that, I’m right,” he smiles smugly.

“Goddamnit, Dean,” Sam mutters. “Alright, we’ll chase after Lucifer. You stay here-”

“No, I’m not staying here,” you shake your head fervently. “I’m going to stay with Crowley.”

“In Hell?”

“Crowley will know some magic to help or at least be able to watch over me in my dreams,” you explain.

“Tabitha, if Lucifer smokes out of the president he can get you there. He can’t get here, it’s warded,” Sam says gently.

“I don’t care, I just need….” you trail off, biting your lip but it doesn’t stop the lump in your throat or the tears from starting to form in your eyes and start tracking down your face.

Neither of the Winchester brothers know what to do now. You’ve rarely cried around either of them but the stress and the disrupted sleep was getting to you in a bad way.

“Okay, do it,” Dean nods solemnly. “You know I’m not his biggest fan but if he helps, go to him Tabs.”

“Thank you,” you manage to get out.

Dean whips out his phone and starts dialling Crowley which you didn’t expect at all. In fact it was the last thing you expected.

“Yeah, it’s me. Well gee, don’t sound so surprised,” Dean makes a face as he walks with the phone. “No, it’s Tabs. She needs you. She-”

“What’s wrong?” Crowley asks immediately upon appearing.

“Wow, can’t even get takeout delivered that fast,” Dean widens his eyes before shaking his head. “Come on, Sammy. Let’s leave them alone.”

You hear something suspiciously like 'I never knew you could be this mature’ from Sam as they both head out, closing the door behind them.

“You’re crying,” Crowley says softly, bundling you into his embrace. “Why are you crying, pet?”

“Lucifer.”

The grip tightens and you can hear the growl starting in his chest.

“Again?”

“Again,” you affirm. “Take me with you.”

“Hell is not a place for you, darling. We both know this. We’ve tried it before and-”

“I don’t care. Take me with you. I can’t stand it any more. You can help me.”

He goes quiet for a time, rocking back and forth with you to calm you down. Just being in his presence is helping you enormously.

“Alright,” he finally agrees. “Pack some things and say your goodbyes to the Chuckle Brothers.”

You do so, eager to get out of the bunker. It’d been so suffocating being here lately and you were glad to be leaving for a little while.

When Crowley appears in his quarters with you, you immediately drag him to the big four poster bed, scrambling onto the silk sheets.

“You’re sending me mixed signals, love,” Crowley raises an eyebrow.

“I just need to be close,” you tell him before taking off his overcoat, jacket and shirt, leaving his chest bare for you to lie on.

“I’ve never seen you like this,” Crowley starts petting your hair. “You’re positively timid.”

“I never get any rest,” you murmur. “If it’s not my dreams, I have these awful visions all the time. I’m cracking up.”

“I’ve got you,” Crowley leans down and kisses your forehead. “I’ll always protect you, pet. You know that, right?”

“I know, I know.”

“Get some sleep. I promise you won’t dream.”

You trust him so you just let yourself absorb the warmth from his skin, the slow movements of his chest and his hand which keeps stroking your hair. You feel your body just relax, all the coiled muscles just letting go and eventually the exhaustion pulls you under.



**



He’s right. You don’t dream.

You woke up some time later, still in the position you fell asleep in only with Crowley humming some melody you didn’t recognise.

“Oh hello, kitten,” you hear him say. “Feel better?”

“A lot,” you admit, rubbing the remnants of sleep out of your eyes. “Thank you.”

“Always, my love.”

You look up at him, seeing the pure affection sparkling in his eyes. It was quite mesmeric in a way. You reach up, taking his bristled cheek in your hand before kissing him softly.

It starts out innocent but becomes something more heated very quickly, even though you didn’t intend it to. Crowley pushes you onto your back so he can lean over you, his hands gently stroking your sides. You can’t help but let soft moans sound out as you move into his touch.

“You are sublime,” he rasps out, drawing back for a second before he dives back on you and you feel the warm metal of your amulet tickling against your skin as he fully seats himself between your legs.

You needed this, you needed him. You needed him to stake a claim so to speak, to feel like you were his completely. Lucifer was trying to take that away from you but you wouldn’t let him.

“You are mine,” Crowley catches the thought. “I have fought so hard to show you that, to be worthy of that. Don’t doubt it now.”

“I love you,” you press your forehead to his.

“I love you always, my kitten.”

Just as you start kissing again, your phone rings out, the ringtone unfamiliar.

“It’s probably important,” Crowley breaks off, giving you a rueful smirk. “Perhaps Dean’s eaten Sam’s chocolate protein balls again.”

You tap him on the chest in mock chastisement before answering it.

“Hello?”

“Tabs?!” comes Dean’s voice.

“Are you okay?!”

“Uh no. No we’re not okay. Listen, I got one phone call-”

“You got arrested?!” your voice pitches up.

“Yeah kinda….by the FBI. We went for him, the big L I mean. He’s outta the president now but he knocked up the secretary. Cas has her but we didn’t manage to get out in time so…help.”

“Yeah, yeah. I’ll do what I can. Sit tight.”

“You’re cute,” comes the sarcastic reply. “Hurry up. Orange is not my colour.”

“Trouble?” Crowley surmises as you hang up.

“Well Lucifer is no longer the president but he’s got another girl pregnant and Sam and Dean are in holding cells, god knows where. Maybe the Pentagon?”

“Just another ordinary day, hmm?” Crowley raises an eyebrow. “I assume they need my assistance as well?”

“Probably,” you nod. “At least I got some rest then.”

“You can always come back once they’re free. I admit, I was sceptical this could work but without my odious mother hanging around all the time, this is like bunking off work to have fun in the storage cupboard.”

“Except the storage cupboard is an expensive bed.”

“Well I can make a cupboard if you really want to. Perhaps a pencil skirt and a blouse with a criminally low amount of buttons?”

“Crowley, I need to help them,” you move out from under him. “We can talk sexy roleplay when they’re not being detained in Guantanamo or wherever.”

“I’m holding you to that,” he winks. “Come on, pet. Let’s save Beavis and Butthead.”

You at least had taken comfort that Lucifer was not in an almost unreachable vessel any more. That gave you a bit more confidence back. Coupled with Crowley’s support and taking care of you, you were refreshed in a way that you hadn’t been for weeks.

Maybe all you really needed was some alone time, some bonding time without interference. There’d been precious little of that lately what with all the catastrophes.

Now you were ready to face the world….if only you could find where the hell the boys were that is….


____

“Okay, do it,” Dean nods solemnly. “You know I’m not his biggest fan but if he helps, go to him Tabs.”

“Thank you,” you manage to get out.

Dean whips out his phone and starts dialling Crowley which you didn’t expect at all. In fact it was the last thing you expected.

“Yeah, it’s me. Well gee, don’t sound so surprised,” Dean makes a face as he walks with the phone. “No, it’s Tabs. She needs you. She-”

“What’s wrong?” Crowley asks immediately upon appearing.

“Wow, can’t even get takeout delivered that fast,” Dean widens his eyes before shaking his head. “Come on, Sammy. Let’s leave them alone.”

You hear something suspiciously like 'I never knew you could be this mature’ from Sam as they both head out, closing the door behind them.

“You’re crying,” Crowley says softly, bundling you into his embrace. “Why are you crying, pet?”

“Lucifer.”

The grip tightens and you can hear the growl starting in his chest.

“Again?”

“Again,” you affirm. “Take me with you.”

“Hell is not a place for you, darling. We both know this. We’ve tried it before and-”

“I don’t care. Take me with you. I can’t stand it any more. You can help me.”

He goes quiet for a time, rocking back and forth with you to calm you down. Just being in his presence is helping you enormously.

“Alright,” he finally agrees. “Pack some things and say your goodbyes to the Chuckle Brothers.”

You do so, eager to get out of the bunker. It’d been so suffocating being here lately and you were glad to be leaving for a little while.

When Crowley appears in his quarters with you, you immediately drag him to the big four poster bed, scrambling onto the silk sheets.

“You’re sending me mixed signals, love,” Crowley raises an eyebrow.

“I just need to be close,” you tell him before taking off his overcoat, jacket and shirt, leaving his chest bare for you to lie on.

“I’ve never seen you like this,” Crowley starts petting your hair. “You’re positively timid.”

“I never get any rest,” you murmur. “If it’s not my dreams, I have these awful visions all the time. I’m cracking up.”

“I’ve got you,” Crowley leans down and kisses your forehead. “I’ll always protect you, pet. You know that, right?”

“I know, I know.”

“Get some sleep. I promise you won’t dream.”

You trust him so you just let yourself absorb the warmth from his skin, the slow movements of his chest and his hand which keeps stroking your hair. You feel your body just relax, all the coiled muscles just letting go and eventually the exhaustion pulls you under.



**



He’s right. You don’t dream.

You woke up some time later, still in the position you fell asleep in only with Crowley humming some melody you didn’t recognise.

“Oh hello, kitten,” you hear him say. “Feel better?”

“A lot,” you admit, rubbing the remnants of sleep out of your eyes. “Thank you.”

“Always, my love.”

You look up at him, seeing the pure affection sparkling in his eyes. It was quite mesmeric in a way. You reach up, taking his bristled cheek in your hand before kissing him softly.

It starts out innocent but becomes something more heated very quickly, even though you didn’t intend it to. Crowley pushes you onto your back so he can lean over you, his hands gently stroking your sides. You can’t help but let soft moans sound out as you move into his touch.

“You are sublime,” he rasps out, drawing back for a second before he dives back on you and you feel the warm metal of your amulet tickling against your skin as he fully seats himself between your legs.

You needed this, you needed him. You needed him to stake a claim so to speak, to feel like you were his completely. Lucifer was trying to take that away from you but you wouldn’t let him.

“You are mine,” Crowley catches the thought. “I have fought so hard to show you that, to be worthy of that. Don’t doubt it now.”

“I love you,” you press your forehead to his.

“I love you always, my kitten.”

Just as you start kissing again, your phone rings out, the ringtone unfamiliar.

“It’s probably important,” Crowley breaks off, giving you a rueful smirk. “Perhaps Dean’s eaten Sam’s chocolate protein balls again.”

You tap him on the chest in mock chastisement before answering it.

“Hello?”

“Tabs?!” comes Dean’s voice.

“Are you okay?!”

“Uh no. No we’re not okay. Listen, I got one phone call-”

“You got arrested?!” your voice pitches up.

“Yeah kinda….by the FBI. We went for him, the big L I mean. He’s outta the president now but he knocked up the secretary. Cas has her but we didn’t manage to get out in time so…help.”

“Yeah, yeah. I’ll do what I can. Sit tight.”

“You’re cute,” comes the sarcastic reply. “Hurry up. Orange is not my colour.”

“Trouble?” Crowley surmises as you hang up.

“Well Lucifer is no longer the president but he’s got another girl pregnant and Sam and Dean are in holding cells, god knows where. Maybe the Pentagon?”

“Just another ordinary day, hmm?” Crowley raises an eyebrow. “I assume they need my assistance as well?”

“Probably,” you nod. “At least I got some rest then.”

“You can always come back once they’re free. I admit, I was sceptical this could work but without my odious mother hanging around all the time, this is like bunking off work to have fun in the storage cupboard.”

“Except the storage cupboard is an expensive bed.”

“Well I can make a cupboard if you really want to. Perhaps a pencil skirt and a blouse with a criminally low amount of buttons?”

“Crowley, I need to help them,” you move out from under him. “We can talk sexy roleplay when they’re not being detained in Guantanamo or wherever.”

“I’m holding you to that,” he winks. “Come on, pet. Let’s save Beavis and Butthead.”

You at least had taken comfort that Lucifer was not in an almost unreachable vessel any more. That gave you a bit more confidence back. Coupled with Crowley’s support and taking care of you, you were refreshed in a way that you hadn’t been for weeks.

Maybe all you really needed was some alone time, some bonding time without interference. There’d been precious little of that lately what with all the catastrophes.

Now you were ready to face the world….if only you could find where the hell the boys were that is….


____

Taglist

@samael-has-arrived @shemehaza @blueboolu @astridstark13 @jointhehunt67 @oldsoulevy @i-only-signed-up-for-fanfiction
trail.content_abstract:
Chapter Summary - The dreams are getting worse and the strain is starting to show

CHAPTER 45 - United States of Lucifer

(Proof reading errors likely)

_______


“Hey my little honey bun, my darling ray of heaven shine, my first love.”

“Would you stop invading my dreams?” you don’t even look up. You just know it’s Lucifer again.

Every night you’d been dreaming about him. Every night he’d been taunting you. Every night he made threats about Crowley.

You’d had enough.

“Well that isn’t nice,” you can hear the pout. “Aren’t you happy for me? I moved on.”

“What?” you look up and you’re aghast to see the president’s face staring back at you. “Shit, you actually did it. You went for the highest authority.”

“Well duh,” he laughs. “Kinda had to right? Can’t mess things up by being a Joe nobody.”

“Wait, you said moved on?”

“Are you jealous?” the face flicks back to his Nick vessel as he comes closer very quickly, trying to study your expression. “Please tell me you’re jealous. I think that’d be soooo hot.”

answer:

i dont process audio very well so if i listen to things with words or too sharp sounds (like piano) ill get confused, so i usually dont listen to anything. theres some ambient music i can stand but most of that makes me very squirmy and uncomfortable, some video game music is fine


💡 Tell me a headcanon (and who you wish would write it)?

sometimes people mistake crowley for an angel, sometimes he doesnt correct them

its not entirely untrue anyway

summary: Good Omens composer David Arnold talking about the series:
title: Good Omens composer David Arnold talking about the series:
body:
“It’ll debut on BBC in the latter part of 2019, as Amazon has it first for 6 months….Good Omens covers so much ground. Four and a half hours of music. It starts at the Garden of Eden, and it moves through Noah’s Ark, the Crucifixion, the Roman Empire, French Revolution, World War I, 60s-or-so London, and ends up round about contemporary times. There are so many amazing characters and so many storylines…Like a juggernaut, it just kind of propels you forward though every episode. And so much stuff is happening. Normally I don’t like having lots and lots of music, but this one feels like it needed to be a part of it…I’ve absolutely loved doing it. Luckily, Neil Gaiman and Douglas Mackinnon liked my initial run at it and then basically left me to do it the way I thought it should be done. There’s lots of discussion, obviously, every moment was discussed, but once we’d had that discussion, it was like, ‘Okay, off you go.’ And I learnt a lot from that experience, because some of the time, if you’re doing a film with a studio, and you know that there are faceless, nameless people who may drop you a note to tell you what they think about what you’ve done, you start having to sort of second guess: ‘Well I don’t know if that guy in that department might like it, and if the trailers guy might like it, and marketing might want this, and they might want that,’ you sort of cripple yourself by thinking about what others’ expectations might be. Because this one is entirely Neil and Doug’s show, Neil is showrunning it, so he’s ultimately the final yay or nay, and it seemed to be: the more extreme and the odder, the better. And the thing about Good Omens is that it shoulders and holds up so many approaches… the thing was, how do we make it coherent? There’s an enormous tentpole in the middle of this, musically, and everything swings off around it, and it’s about establishing the central thing immediately. And then from that all the other character pieces came. I learned to play [instruments] for this; there’s 8 bars of chromatic harmonica for one scene. It went from the 14th century, to the 17th century, to the 20th century, to the future, to Heaven, to Hell. All in all, whole scores get done and dumped all the time; I’m very pleased that [mine wasn’t.]”

(From the Kermode on Film podcast #13)

Crowley Eusdford was going to die.
